intro: Spiesia trautvetteri, commonly known as the Trautvetter's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia, a feature typical of the genus. Spiesia trautvetteri is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
